server.name: ai.com.mcp/contabo
server.description: Contabo API (v1.0.0) as MCP tools for cloud provisioning, and management. Powered by HAPI MCP server
server.title: Contabo (VPS) MCP Server

headers.description: Bearer token for authenticating with the Contabo API. Obtain via the documented token endpoint.
headers.name: Authorization

headers.description: Optional request ID for tracing (recommended for support/debugging)
headers.name: x-request-id

examples.config: Add 'https://contabo.run.mcp.com.ai/mcp' as a remote MCP server in your MCP client. Ensure ACCESS_TOKEN is set in Authorization argument.
examples.description: Connect to the Contabo MCP server to manage cloud resources (VPS, VDS, Object Storage, etc.)
examples.name: Basic Connection

examples.description: List all your Contabo compute instances using the MCP tools
examples.name: Get Instances
examples.note: Ask the MCP client (i.e.: https://chat.mcp.com.ai) to invoke the 'listInstances' tool to retrieve your VPS and VDS instances

examples.description: Obtain ACCESS_TOKEN using documented OAuth2 flow (see docs and example curl in contabo.md)
examples.name: Authentication

notes: This MCP server exposes the full Contabo API as MCP tools for cloud automation.
Authentication is required for all operations. Obtain credentials from the Contabo Customer Control Panel.
Download the full API specification from https://api.contabo.com, or from the HAPI MCP server documentation: https://docs.mcp.com.ai/servers-apis/openapi/
See https://api.contabo.com/#section/Introduction and https://contabo.com/en-us/contabo-api/ for full API documentation.
Run your own HAPI MCP server using Docker: docker run -p 3030:3030  -v ~/.hapi:/app/.hapi serve contabo --port 3030 --headless --url https://api.contabo.com
Or the HAPI MCP CLI: hapi serve contabo --port 3030 --headless --url https://api.contabo.com --openapi https://docs.mcp.com.ai/apis/openapi/contabo.json
Documentation: https://docs.mcp.com.ai/deployment/

server.name: ai.com.mcp/hapi-mcp
server.description: HAPI MCP server: Dynamically exposes OpenAPI REST APIs as MCP tools for AI assistants
server.title: HAPI MCP Server

headers.description: Authorization token for accessing the MCP server
headers.name: Authorization

runtimeArguments.description: Port mapping for the host to container (e.g., '3030:3030'). Adjust second port if changing internal container port (HAPI_PORT)
runtimeArguments.name: -p

runtimeArguments.description: Volume mapping for HAPI configuration directory
runtimeArguments.name: -v

packageArguments.description: Command to start the HAPI MCP server
packageArguments.name: serve

packageArguments.description: The name of the project/API to serve (e.g., 'petstore'). Optional when using HAPI_OPENAPI environment variable
packageArguments.name: projectName

packageArguments.description: The port to listen on inside the container
packageArguments.name: --port

packageArguments.description: Run in headless mode (serve MCP-only, no business logic)
packageArguments.name: --headless

packageArguments.description: The server provides REST API's business logic AND also exposes them as MCP tools
packageArguments.name: --mcp

packageArguments.description: Enable development mode with verbose logging
packageArguments.name: --dev

packageArguments.description: The full URL for the backend API server (overrides OpenAPI spec servers). Uses OAS server URL if not provided
packageArguments.name: --url

packageArguments.description: OpenAPI spec file path or URL to use instead of loading from HAPI_HOME
packageArguments.name: --openapi

packageArguments.description: Comma-separated list of allowed origins for CORS (e.g., 'http://localhost:3000,https://example.com')
packageArguments.name: --cors

packageArguments.description: Comma-separated list of OAS configuration files to apply (can be URLs)
packageArguments.name: --filename

packageArguments.description: Path to SSL certificate file for HTTPS. Volume mount required if using Docker. https://docs.mcp.com.ai/components/hapi-server/hapi-cli#running-with-tls-https
packageArguments.name: --cert

packageArguments.description: Path to SSL key file for HTTPS. Volume mount required if using Docker
packageArguments.name: --key

environmentVariables.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name for the HAPI server (used in MCP tool URLs)
environmentVariables.name: HAPI_FQDN

environmentVariables.description: Directory path for HAPI configuration and specs. Should be mounted as a volume in Docker
environmentVariables.name: HAPI_HOME

environmentVariables.description: The name of the project/API (alternative to positional argument)
environmentVariables.name: PROJECT_NAME

environmentVariables.description: OpenAPI spec URL or path (alternative to --openapi flag)
environmentVariables.name: HAPI_OPENAPI

environmentVariables.description: Backend API base URL (alternative to --url flag)
environmentVariables.name: HAPI_URL

environmentVariables.description: Server port (alternative to --port flag) - this is the internal container port
environmentVariables.name: HAPI_PORT

environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated allowed CORS origins (alternative to --cors flag)
environmentVariables.name: HAPI_CORS

environmentVariables.description: Node environment (development, production). 'development' enables verbose logging and debugging features.
environmentVariables.name: NODE_ENV

HAPI_FQDN.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name for the HAPI server

examples.command: docker run -p 3030:3030 -v ~/.hapi:/app/.hapi hapimcp/hapi-cli:0.6.0 serve petstore --port 3030 --headless --url https://petstore3.swagger.io/api/v3
examples.description: Save specs in ~/.hapi/specs. Download example if not present: https://petstore3.swagger.io/api/v3/swagger.json
examples.name: Quick Start with a local API spec

examples.command: docker run -p 3030:3030 -e HAPI_OPENAPI=https://api.example.com/openapi.json -e HAPI_URL=https://api.example.com hapimcp/hapi-cli:0.6.0 serve my-api --headless
examples.description: Serve a custom API using environment variables
examples.name: Custom OpenAPI with Environment Variables

examples.description: Run with persistent volumes and custom specs
examples.name: Docker Compose Setup

server.name: ai.com.mcp/petstore
server.description: Swagger Petstore API (v1.0.27) as MCP for testing and prototyping powered by the HAPI MCP server
server.title: Petstore MCP Server

examples.config: Add 'https://petstore.run.mcp.com.ai/mcp' as a remote MCP server in your MCP client
examples.description: Connect to the Petstore MCP server to access pet store operations
examples.name: Basic Connection

examples.description: The server exposes all Petstore API operations as MCP tools including: findPetsByStatus, getPetById, addPet, updatePet, deletePet, and more
examples.name: Available Operations
examples.note: See https://petstore3.swagger.io for the full API specification

notes: This is a demo server hosted by La Rebelion Labs
The backend API is https://petstore3.swagger.io/api/v3
No authentication required for basic operations
Rate limits may apply
For production use, deploy your own HAPI MCP server

server.name: ai.com.mcp/registry
server.description: Publish and discover MCP servers via the official MCP Registry. Powered by HAPI MCP server.
server.title: MCP Registry Server

examples.config: Add 'https://registry.run.mcp.com.ai/mcp' as a remote MCP server in your MCP client.
examples.description: Connect to the official MCP Registry server to discover and publish MCP servers.
examples.name: Basic Connection

examples.description: The server exposes all MCP Registry API operations as MCP tools, including: server publishing, search, update, and more.
examples.name: Available Operations
examples.note: See https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/registry/tree/main/docs/reference/api/openapi.yaml for the full API specification.

notes: This is the MCP Registry server pointing to the official MCP Registry backend.
The backend API is https://registry.modelcontextprotocol.io.
Public discovery endpoints are available without authentication.
Rate limits may apply.
For self-hosting, run your own HAPI MCP server using:
Docker: docker run -p 3030:3030  -v ~/.hapi:/app/.hapi serve registry --port 3030 --headless --url https://registry.modelcontextprotocol.io

The HAPI MCP CLI: hapi serve registry --port 3030 --headless --url https://registry.modelcontextprotocol.io --openapi https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/registry/raw/refs/heads/main/docs/reference/api/openapi.yaml

Deploy to Cloudflare: hapi deploy --name mcp-registry --openapi https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/registry/raw/refs/heads/main/docs/reference/api/openapi.yaml --url https://registry.modelcontextprotocol.io
Documentation: https://docs.mcp.com.ai/deployment/
